How to Get a Meldezettel (Address Registration) in Austria üè†üá¶üáπ

Published: Mar 6, 2025 |  at  05:06 AM
| Suggest Changes

If you are living in Austria, you must register your address within 3 days of moving into a new accommodation. This registration is called the Meldezettel and is required for visa applications, bank accounts, insurance, and other legal processes.

‚úÖ What is a Meldezettel?

‚úîÔ∏è A mandatory address registration required by Austrian law.
‚úîÔ∏è Confirms where you live and is needed for official purposes.
‚úîÔ∏è Must be registered within 3 days of moving into a new place.

üí° If you do not register on time, you could face fines of up to ‚Ç¨726!

üìå Where to Register for a Meldezettel?

You need to visit your local Magistrat (Municipal Office) or Meldeamt (Registration Office).

üìç Find your local Meldeamt:
üîó **Vienna District Offices (Magistratisches Bezirksamt) **

üí° Tip: You do NOT need an appointment ‚Äì just walk in during office hours.

üìù Documents Required for Meldezettel Registration

‚úîÔ∏è Meldezettel Form (Download here: Meldezettel PDF)
‚úîÔ∏è Passport or Residence Permit
‚úîÔ∏è Rental Contract (Optional, but recommended)
‚úîÔ∏è Wohnrechtsvereinbarung (Proof of Residence Agreement, if needed)
‚úîÔ∏è Landlord‚Äôs Signature (The landlord must sign the Meldezettel form)

üí° If you are subletting a room, the main tenant must sign the Meldezettel form.

üìå Step-by-Step Guide to Registering Your Address

1Ô∏è‚É£ Fill Out the Meldezettel Form

‚úîÔ∏è Download and print the Meldezettel form:
üîó Meldezettel PDF

‚úîÔ∏è Fill in your personal details & address.
‚úîÔ∏è Your landlord or main tenant must sign the form.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Go to Your Local Registration Office (Meldeamt)

‚úîÔ∏è Find the Magistrat (district office) near your home.
‚úîÔ∏è Bring your Meldezettel, passport, and rental contract.
‚úîÔ∏è Walk in and submit your form.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Receive Your Meldezettel Confirmation

‚úîÔ∏è The officer will stamp and return your Meldezettel immediately.
‚úîÔ∏è Keep this document safe! You will need it for:

  • Bank account registration
  • Residence permit renewal
  • Insurance & university applications

üîç How to Change or Cancel Your Address Registration?

‚úîÔ∏è Moving to a new address? ‚Üí Submit a new Meldezettel at your new district office.
‚úîÔ∏è Leaving Austria? ‚Üí Deregister (Abmeldung) before moving out.

üí° You can submit deregistration online:
üîó Online Abmeldung Form

üí∞ Are There Any Fees?

‚úîÔ∏è Meldezettel registration is FREE.
‚úîÔ∏è If you need a duplicate copy, you may have to pay ‚Ç¨15.30.

‚ö†Ô∏è Common Problems & How to Solve Them

IssueSolution
Landlord refuses to sign?Show them the legal requirement. They must sign by law.
Forgot to register within 3 days?Register as soon as possible to avoid fines.
Need a copy of Meldezettel?Request one from the Meldeamt for ‚Ç¨15.30.

üìû Need More Help?

üìç Vienna Meldeamt Offices: Find Your District Office
üìû Customer Service: +43 1 4000 3535
üì¢ Join Our WhatsApp Group for student support!

üîó Final Summary: How to Get a Meldezettel in Austria

‚úîÔ∏è Fill out the Meldezettel form & get the landlord‚Äôs signature.
‚úîÔ∏è Visit the local Meldeamt & submit your documents.
‚úîÔ∏è Receive your stamped Meldezettel immediately.
‚úîÔ∏è Use it for visa, banking, and legal processes.

üéâ Now You Know How to Register Your Address in Austria!
Make sure you complete this step within 3 days to avoid fines. üöÄ
